intent_atoms.description: Curate a catalog of MP4/QuickTime fixtures covering standard, fragmented, and vendor-specific atoms for parsing, validation, and benchmarking suites.
Produce a ranked list of sample sources with licensing notes and download metadata.
Ensure the catalog covers core MP4 families (progressive moov/mdat, fragmented moof/traf), metadata-heavy assets, and edge cases referenced in benchmarking runbooks.
Document storage and size requirements so CI or hardware runners can stage media without exhausting quotas.
All downloaded fixtures must have SHA-256 checksums recorded in a manifest for integrity verification.
License texts must be mirrored under Documentation/FixtureCatalog/licenses/ and referenced from the manifest to satisfy attribution requirements.
Store large assets under Distribution/Fixtures/<category>/ while keeping lightweight regression fixtures inside the test bundle.
Use Tests/ISOInspectorKitTests/Fixtures/generate_fixtures.py to ingest a manifest-driven remote download workflow with deterministic filenames.

functional_units.name: Fixture Catalog Manifest Generation
functional_units.description: Generate a manifest.json capturing source URL, SHA-256 checksum, license snippet, and coverage tags for each fixture

functional_units.name: Scripted Fixture Download Helper
functional_units.description: Extend generate_fixtures.py to download fixtures from URLs specified in the manifest and emit deterministic filenames

functional_units.name: Checksum Validation Process
functional_units.description: Validate downloaded files against recorded SHA-256 checksums and log digests for CI verification

functional_units.name: Storage Allocation Strategy
functional_units.description: Allocate and document storage targets (e.g., 40 GB macOS, 15 GB Linux) for staging media fixtures

functional_units.name: License Mirroring and Attribution
functional_units.description: Mirror license texts under Documentation/FixtureCatalog/licenses/ and reference them in the manifest to satisfy attribution requirements

functional_units.name: Vendor Telemetry Fixture Support
functional_units.description: Include vendor-specific UUID metadata boxes (GoPro, DJI) in fixture set for telemetry parsing coverage

functional_units.name: Progressive MP4 Coverage
functional_units.description: Provide progressive MP4 samples with canonical moov/mdat ordering from Apple and Bento4 sources

functional_units.name: Fragmented MP4 Coverage
functional_units.description: Provide fragmented MP4 samples (moof/traf) from Apple HLS, DASH-IF, GPAC datasets

functional_units.name: Metadata-Rich Asset Support
functional_units.description: Include high-bitrate cinematic MP4s with large co64 tables and metadata boxes from Blender Foundation and Xiph.org

functional_units.name: Malformed/Truncated Sample Inclusion
functional_units.description: Add intentionally malformed or truncated MP4 samples for parser regression testing (Xiph.org)
